page.title: 08Islamic Mosque, Sheffield
page.content: Our{mosque}is very big and has two large halls. We have extended the building by installing eight toilets and washrooms. Here we can wash our hands, faces and feet before we pray. There are two smaller rooms facing Mecca where we go without shoes to read our Qur'ans and say our prayers. About 150 men and boys attend our mosque but no women or girls. We are planting a vegetable garden next to the mosque. During June it was{Ramadan,}all adults and children over 12 years fasted from sunrise until sunset for one month. You couldn't even drink water or put your finger in your mouth. At our mosque the Imam led the prayers about 3am, 2.30pm, 8pm, 9.30pm and 11pm during Ramadan. For our Christmas we are given money and new clothes.
